website_summaries.verdict: Whether you need reasonably priced, well-made shoes for work or casual wear, these loafers are worth considering if you prefer a style that's easy to put on and looks good for numerous occasions.
pros: Stands out for the easy slip-on style that's lightweight, comfortable and attractive
Owners rave about how comfortable they are, even for all-day wear
cons: These shoes run a bit narrow, so some men may have to go up in size
They also tend to squeak on some types of floors

customer_reviews.title: Awesome design, great fit, but less quality than I am used to with Clarks!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite Clarks shoe. I have been trying to find them for years, it seems they have been either out of stock or discontinued for awhile? I got really excited to see they were back and immediately ordered a new pair. I must agree with many others that the quality is not like they used to be. Unfortunately, it's less than 2 weeks of wear and a seam is already busted on the side edge of the left shoe. They are worn as a daily work shoe and I had no major wear this past week and a half besides normal work hour routine and walking. I am disappointed by this, but maybe I got a dud?
customer_reviews.author: BenH79

customer_reviews.title: Current version of shoe can't compare to Escalades of the past
customer_reviews.text: My third pair of Clarks Escalades. Used to be a fantastic shoe, with all day comfort. Second pair lasted five+ years. Recent construction of the shoe is cheap, like, strip-mall shoe store cheap. Broke my heart I can't get a replacement of my prior Escalades. They were fantastic looking and comfortable, and lasted for years. Not only does this one feel cheaply made, it looks trashy as well. I've since moved to Ecco shoes since I've tried several pairs of Clarks in the past year, and all seemed chintzy.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Bartow

customer_reviews.title: You may as well be wearing jack hammers
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look great and are comfortable. Everything you would expect from shoes of this quality and price point, EXCEPT, these are bar none the most noisy shoes I have ever owned in 48 years on the planet. If you only walk on carpet this will not be a problem but each step you take on a hard surface will come with the most obnoxious rubber squeak you've ever experienced. I work in a hospital and simply can not wear these while working. Patients need quiet and rest. These shoes are so loud they could wake a neighborhood. I'm extremely disappointed with this purchase. I've owned many pairs of Clarks without this issue - not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues 1 day wear
customer_reviews.text: These got a two for now the workmanship on the pair I received was not good (I will share photos) but these are extremely comfortable and they are sending a replacement pair and will give higher rating if the are better quality, but I received these on a Friday afternoon and wore them 1 day on Saturday (nothing extensive) just looked at some new houses Saturday and I put them on Monday morning and the stitching is coming apart and a hole had been exposed which is a shame because I found these to be very comfortable possibly my new favorites
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: These shoes seem very comfortable at first
customer_reviews.text: I have to disagree with most folks here. These shoes seem very comfortable at first, but are VERY uncomfortable after standing in them for an hour. Inside the shoe, there is a "Soft Cushion with OrthoLite" padded brown leather-look portion under the back half of the foot, and a tan fabric section under the front half of the foot. In the place where these two sections meet, a very painful ridge runs right under my plantar tendons. I felt like I was standing on a garden hose after a while. If I wore these for very long, I suspect I'd be in the doctor's office with plantar fasciitis. I'll be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I used to be obsessed with Skechers GoWalk but the only I hated was their look. A friend recommended toe Clark's and man the hit every thing right. First of all they are so comfy and great to wear for work where I tend to walk often. The look great and very nice. The only thing I hated is my brown pair color, which is not easy to pair with belt. It is either to light or darker than most of options I found in the market. Other than that I am totally satisfied with it and totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shehab Alamery

customer_reviews.title: Great looking shoe but soles crack easily
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes for my husband (in Oct 2017) who has to dress up two to three times a month. These shoes look great but the sole cracked in half in the middle of the arch. These shoes have barely any wear on them. They still look brand new. For the life of us, we can not figure out what cause them to crack in half from side to side. Definitely would not purchase again. Extremely disappointed with what little wear they have had. Should have lasted years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Update 4 months after purchase: Sole is starting separate from shoe. Wear 3 times a week, stand and sit most of time. Purchase 3/2017: What is up with the sole of the shoe. I have owned Clark Escalades before and my most recent lasted 3 years. The ones I use to have had a rubber sole and the new ones feel almost like plastic?! I am sliding all over the place. What gives?! I wonder what I would find if I went to a store. Is this some kind of knock off?!
customer_reviews.author: R_i_c_k

customer_reviews.title: Old stand bys
customer_reviews.text: I have the same pair of shoes I purchased 12 years ago and loved. The sole finally fell apart. I wore these shoes, on average 5 times a month to travel, so allot of walking. I searched for their replacements and these are it. One note, these shoes are going to take a minute to break in. I saw previous reviews of people saying they were tight or slippery. Wear the shoes for a couple days and all that goes away and all you'll be left with is very comfortable dress shoes. Sorry to see the old ones go, happy to be breaking in a new pair. Here's to the next 12 years!
customer_reviews.author: B. Sommer

customer_reviews.title: Very Low quality, possibly knockoffs.
customer_reviews.text: I buy Clark's all the time. But this one is way less quality than what I have come to expect. I decided I didnt like them before I even tried them on. Super cheap plastic soles and the even smelled like cheap plastic. I swear these are cheap, Chinese knockoffs. You cant tell by the looks and logos but you sure can when you hold them in your hand and see them up close. If they really are Clark's, the quality has gone way down. Stay away from this pair.
customer_reviews.author: MCTronix

customer_reviews.title: nice for the price, but...
customer_reviews.text: Well-priced shoes, but on the tight side versus my older Clarks. The shoes are a little "lighter" than those older Clarks. The negatives: the heel is much too tight (and structured) to make them an easy slip-on, expect to have a seat and use a shoe-horn. The styling is also not their best. It's hard to see in the product photo, but the top "tongue" is partially detached (it protrudes from the body of the shoe). Combined with the center stitching, it has an oddly casual look, like they made a loafer out of stiff dress-shoe material. Not the best aesthetic. Add in the tightness, and they are going back.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Siddique

customer_reviews.title: terrible shoes
customer_reviews.text: Clarks should take their name off these shoes. These Clarks are the most uncomfortable shoes I have ever worn because of the brick like sole. Clarks have really reached a new low by putting out such poor quality shoes with their name attached. Try Clarks Men's Unsheridan Go Slip-On Loafer. You will pay triple the price but finally get a shoe worthy of the Clarks name.
customer_reviews.author: MARY

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes squeaks as I walk (just on some surfaces). I can't have coworkers or clients think that I'm squeaking out farts when I walk. This pair of shoes has killed over 10 years of loyalty I had had for the Clarks brand. Some manager probably decided to cut a corner and save on costs. The fool probably got a bonus for it despite killing customer confidence.
customer_reviews.author: A. Argentum

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be very good so far
customer_reviews.text: I read the negative reviews, but I don't see anything wrong yet. These shoes are okay so far. Of course I've worn them only four days, but do far I like them. I have Parkinsonism, so shoes don't last very long for me. These Clarkes are very comfortable and fit well. I think they will last longer than most of my shoes. All in all, I think they are a good pair of shoes for not much money. July 19, 2020: Update. I'm still wearing these shoes. No real visible wear yet, and very comfortable. My favorite pair. A great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: runbux

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a good shoe and very soft and gentle on the foot compared to other dress shoes. Not much arch support. However it seems a little tight at the opening and a little too snug on the top of my foot. I believe this can get fixed by making the opening a little larger for a wide shoe rather that going with the default measurement. Overall this is a great shoe and for the price its great. I will do a updated review to report the quality of this shoe to see if it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B

customer_reviews.title: This version of the Clarks Escalade is not up to par
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace a worn out pair of Clarks Escalades for my husband. He’s always on his feet and needs good shoes. This version is made of much stiffer leather and isn’t nearly as comfortable as his previous pairs of the same style. They look nice but they require breaking in and his previous pairs of Escalades were comfy right out of the box. I’m probably going to buy him a pair of Ecco loafers and/or a pair of Vionic Preston Loafers, both of which are supposed to be excellent for people who spend a lot of time on their feet. We’ll see, I guess!
customer_reviews.author: PlusSizedHairdresser

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair of these and they fit great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read a lot about the quality of these going downhill. I’m not sure about the durability, but the last pair I bought of these exact shoes were purchased over two years ago and worn almost every day, until they had to be replaced because of the slick soles. The arch support had worn out by then, but these feel great out of the box. Very comfortable, quick break in and all day comfort.
customer_reviews.author: T. Trebuna

customer_reviews.title: Best business slip on shoe ever!
customer_reviews.text: I tried my hand at Amazon Wardrobe and had three shoes come in, including one more that wasn't wardrobe approved. Out of the four shoes Clarks was the most comfortable and has proven to stand up to daily use including lots of walking. Also no weird crease's in the leather and they are very comfortable and easy to slip on. The other shoes that didn't make the mark were the following: Skechers Men's Work Cttonwood Goddard Slip On Bostonian Men's Bolton Free Oxford Hunter's Bay Black Men's Spencer Slip-On Dress
customer_reviews.author: Joey Troy

customer_reviews.title: Walking on a cloud
customer_reviews.text: These shoes help you to feel like your walking on a cloud. The person that these were gifted to walks a lot during their regular daily activity during the week. They stated that these were better than some others they had previously for walking to transportation for work and are so glad that there toes don't feel cramped while walking. Usually they would have run the shoes over after a month of use, but these Clark's are still going strong. You know Clarks is a well made shoe and they are a great price here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer57

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have wide, long feet and usually wear a 14. The width between the widest parts of my feet where my pinkie toe and big to start felt very tight when I first put these on. After walking around in them for about 30 minutes outside, they feel better now but they are still a tight fit. My feet are about 12.25" long and 4.5" across at the widest point.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan M.

customer_reviews.title: superior comfort, great fit
customer_reviews.text: I already have a pair of Clarks very similar in design to these. I love them. They fit perfectly and are one of the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned. I knew the size I wanted ahead of time, but I did check out their size recommendation questionnaire. They were spot on. Even though I normally wear a size 12, they recommended an 11.5. This was perfect. I had already been wearing an 11.5, so I felt confident ordering that size again. When they arrived, they fit perfectly. So comfortable, I can wear them all day and evening long with no fatigue. I also ordered these in brown. Best shoes ever.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. John

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves These Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I think we have bought about 4 pairs of these shoes throughout the past 3-4 years. My husband walks a lot at work and he is hard on his shoes but these hold up so well. And they are very comfortable. They slip on so that's a plus, they have an actual "pillow" in the heel for comfort there and they are really well made. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: fleopatratexas

customer_reviews.title: Clark Brand and they last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I've had several pair of Clark shoes and these do fit a little tighter than the other ones I've had. I'm assuming they will break in with time. I don't wear them a lot so it will take time to break them in. They aren't so tight that they're uncomfortable to wear. I simply like Clark shoes better than any other brand I've ever owned because they last a long time. I think they're a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Noel A Guthmiller

customer_reviews.title: Look good but if you have larger feet, pass.
customer_reviews.text: I need shoes that I can fit into when my feet are swollen. The opening is too narrow despite it being a wide width for someone like me. The shoe looks good and I'm sure it would do well if I could actually get my feet into them. Only reason I knocked the stars down. It was really difficult to tell how much flexibility there was with slipping them on. Short answer: Next to none.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally getting another pair after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these for work 5 days a week for the past three years and I am finally buying a new pair only because the color has faded a little due to water getting on them from rain. Great shoes and will be my go to for years to come for work. I have the brown pair and black pair. Awesome shoes.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: a little narrow up front.
customer_reviews.text: love them and very comfortable, but a little narrow in the front and the front feels cramped, but fine while walking. Been wearing it all day and no issues. updated 3/17/207: -------------------------------- Changed to 1 star. Stitching is coming apart on the side where the leather and the sole meet. This is after 6 months of very light use. Others have noticed the same as well. will attach pictures later
customer_reviews.author: a.t

customer_reviews.title: Clarks are great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Clarks makes great comfortable shoes. Before I ordered these, I went to an actual Clarks store and bought the exact same model, only in black. I wore those for about a month and loved how comfortable and lightweight they were. The slip on aspect of the shoes are easy and don't press into my feet leaving bruises. The cushions inside give a little spring to your step. I added some insoles in my shoes so that I won't mess up the interior. For almost half the retail price, I would highly recommend these shoes for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy L.

customer_reviews.title: Made my feet feel worse.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look nice I can give them that. But I don't know what happened to Clarks. I tried a pair on in store and had to return them as well. These shoes make my feet hurt more than my flat vans do when I stand all day for work. I was really dissapointed and thought maybe I was tripping. But my feet where aching so much after wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Slip on dress shoes
customer_reviews.text: Feels comfortable at first. Hurts later after standing for couple hours. Don't expect these to last forever. Cheaply made. But you get what you pay for as these are not expensive shoes. They look decent.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: I received the shoes on the expected day in good condition. They look really good and am thinking of buying a black pair as well, but I want to wait till I get the chance to wear these for a few days first. That will not happen till some dry weather though. The only think I have concern about these shoes is the relative stiffness of the leather top, but I wait with my final judgement until I wore them for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: JoPa

customer_reviews.title: Great dress shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these same dress shoes. I love them, they are by far the most comfortable dress shoes I have ever owned. I wear dress shoes everyday to work and I wear these when ever I can because they are so comfortable. The look it great as well it has a squared for box so it gives it the same great look as shoes twice the cost.
customer_reviews.author: FireDad68

customer_reviews.title: Good but question longevity.
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking shoes and are comfortable but I question long term quality with these (as with most shoe brands that used to be good). I had a pair of these that lasted me for 5+ years and had a way more solid feel to them. Clarks (of England/china?) and other companies should give you the option of a higher quality version of these for an added cost. We understand the need to be price competitive but don't assume the customer wouldn't spend a little more to get the same quality they used to get.
customer_reviews.author: Justin c

customer_reviews.title: One shoe is smaller than the other...
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice shoes. The right shoe is noticeably smaller than the left though. It's even possible to see it in the photo attached. The size marked on the right shoe is correct, but it feels like an 11.5 though marked as a 12. I have worn them for a few days and the right shoe has loosened up a bit, but is still a little uncomfortable. I can live with it. I didn't want to return them from overseas because it costs me more than Amazon will reimburse. Otherwise the shoes are very well made and look good.
customer_reviews.author: BigOlBear

customer_reviews.title: Very nice comfort
customer_reviews.text: As my first pair of Clarks, I have to say I am pretty impressed. The shoe (I got it in wide) fits perfect all around. The creamy brown leather is very nice and the look is classic. The first couple of days, before the soles were broken in, it was quite the squeaky shoe on polished floors, as others had said. But now that the bottoms are scuffed up from regular use a couple days, it's good and quiet. Might be my new favorite brand.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Larose

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and a great price.
customer_reviews.text: My husband brought these along on our Vegas vacation (where we walk a lot) even though he had not worn them yet. He wound up wearing them one day we didn't expect to walk a ton, and then we did. After that, he wore those shoes the entire trip instead of his tennis shoes because they were so comfortable. He didn't even have his usual sciatic pain! He now has these in 2 colors.
customer_reviews.author: OurParticularPerspective

customer_reviews.title: great for the wide-footed
customer_reviews.text: Not only do I have wide feet, but I kept wracking my big toe and still had to go to work. With these shoes, I could wrap my toes and still have room. Plus, they're comfortable and fairly durable. Minus one star in the style category, though, as they are meh-looking, according to my girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: DAS FRISCHMACHER

customer_reviews.title: Good value shoe
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good shoe. Never did quite mold to my foot shape entirely, but it is fairly comfortable. No issues with anything coming apart or quality control issues. Don't think I've ever polished them and they still look good a year later. Am thinking about getting another pair as they wear well. Good bang for the buck as $70 doesn't get you much of a dress shoe anymore. Plus they came in a wide width which I need.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking shoe but runs a little small so size up if uncertain
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these shoes at a store but they only had size 13. I've purchased other Clarks men's shoes and 13 sometimes fit fine (I can sometimes were size 13 but find more often I'm a 13W or 14). However, these are constructed trimmer so I had to return them. I was happy to find these in a size 13W on Amazon so I bought them. This size fits nicely and even wore them to work today. Happy I got the wider size so keep this in mind when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected and looks great
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 10 but ordered 9.5 since I like short-term shoes to be snug. This one fits good and there were no strange surprised. I would buy again in a different color and recommend it. I have not worn long term yet but will provide further details.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic looking shoe, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe. While the recommended size does feel a bit too snug it's not uncomfortable enough for me to spend the time to return. They look great and are much more well made and scuff resistant than other brands I have recently bought *dockers*. They are a bit slippery, especially for someone who works in and around auto repair shops regularly. I will definitely buy them again, only next time one more size up.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyK

customer_reviews.title: Economic, but not long lasting...
customer_reviews.text: These hit the right price point and they feel good. That said, they start to break down after about 6 months? I'm not a heavy walker, 5k steps / day is my average. Bought in Aug 2019, needed to be replaced in Feb 2020. Be informed and realize they will not last a year.
customer_reviews.author: FredB

customer_reviews.title: coming apart after 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Shoe looks great, and felt comfortable overall. PROBLEM. It is coming unstitched at the sole the week after returns are allowed. Always loved Clarks, but this is the 2nd pair in one year that is NOT lasting. Dissappointed that a favorite shoe company has joined others and left behind a quality product for fast production.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Ray

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are wrong
customer_reviews.text: Had Clarks for many years, bought these to replace my current wet weather shoes. The sizes listed are simply wrong. My foot would could not fit into the shoe, at all. I have worn the same size Clarks for nearly 2 decades; always the same size. Being that I'm international, not worth returning them due to shipping, will sell them to someone in HK.
customer_reviews.author: B. Singh

customer_reviews.title: Not a Clarks shoe, it seems ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes did not appear to be made of as strange shiny "leather". The shoe is different from any photos on Amazon web site. Website says an Amazon product but is shipped from a third party without the normal Clarks quality evident and a size that is not comfortable. Am returning the day after receipt.
customer_reviews.author: Rkellerhouse

customer_reviews.title: I have worn Clarks for 15 years but this was an anomaly
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was completely different from all other Clark Escalades that I have worn. Stiffer material, different looking, different innersole, harder sole....just not at all like my "REAL" Clark shoes. I could not wear them, too small, uncomfortable....I suspect they are a knock-off but would have to send them to Clarks to prove it. If either Clarks, or Amazon, wants them, they sit unused in my closet for your research and review.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe! Difficult to remove insole
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these we’ve ordered in 3 years. It is a work shoe for my husband and they have been great!! The only complaint is that the insole is very difficult (Required prying with a screwdriver) to get out of you need to replace with an orthodic.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Clarks are the best
customer_reviews.text: Unlike prior reviewers, these are great Perhaps a different batch. Hubby loves these. shoes My husband put them on an said just like Clarks He has 4 pairs of clarks now and loves thdem all I have3 pairs, myself Thanks Amazon fot selling quality products
customer_reviews.author: lina m. F.

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe wasn't true to size. Looked cheap. I have had multiple Clark's before, the quality is not the same as other Clark shoes. I return them immediately. Amazon return process was fast and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: MAG

customer_reviews.title: they are sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These were a replacement for the shoes my husband wears to work daily. So far, they are sturdy and comfortable. They appear to be of good quality, and the Amazon price was much cheaper than other places. I sprayed them with salt/water protector to prevent stains, so that should help them last longer. The only down side I see is that the soles are smoother than other similar shoes he's worn in the past, so there will be less grip when walking on wet or icy surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: RX8-04

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and finish, comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at my shoes and then looked inside. They are still ok but you can clearly see how they are worn. I have used them everyday in Wisconsin since I bought them in mid 2016 until now. I am online to buy two more pair, black and brown. I guess I am all set for another three years?
customer_reviews.author: Newbully

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit along the top of the foot
customer_reviews.text: I thought the length and the width was good but the top of the foot towards the ankle was really tight. I'm hoping this will loosen up given that it is leather. I have already thrown away my old shoes so I'm going to have to make due with this pair. This is interesting because I have bought 3 back to back to back Clark shoes of the same style and none of them fit tight like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time is on my side
customer_reviews.text: Shoes arrived on time. Well packaged. First impressions, slightly smaller than other Clarks following advise, to buy 1/2 size smaller. I have bought other Clarks @ 9 1/2 wide & OK. As to width a little worried--doing TV wearing as I have a month to return. Comfortable footbed--well made (so far)-nice looking shoe--gotta tell the truth for others--- I'll post again in a week to see if it is just new stiffness
customer_reviews.author: Walter de la Brosse

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. So much so that I’m going to order a brown pair. I have lots of feet problem getting ingrown nails, neuroma, and calluses. These help my feet feel good all day with my 15k+ steps each day at work. They look great with a pair of jeans, khakis or dress pants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They're a great walking shoe and a good looking shoe for an evening out.
customer_reviews.text: They have plenty of toe room, but they're a little tight width-wise, but a friend said shoes usually expand width-wise. They look good, feel comfortable, and I can wear these out in the evening rather than black sneaker-type walking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: K Chieff

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: I always bought Clarks shoes but this time i got really disappointed with the quality and foot support the shoes had. First of all starting from the shoe box looked very cheap the shoes itself looked like piece of hard plastic no flexibility whatsoever and after wearing them for 7 hours I started feeling pain on my foot . I don’t know if the company Clarks is going down the hill and cutting cost and providing cheap quality shoes or the shoes i got from Amazon.com
customer_reviews.author: dnyc

customer_reviews.title: As good as All Clarks I bought
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for gentlemen. This pair of shoes can fit my outfits. The quality is as good as all my other CLARKS. Feel a little tight at the beginning (his feet are so used to slippers in these 2 months :) ). But feel good after a while.
customer_reviews.author: family father

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: I've got several pairs of Clark's, all size 10M, ranging from casual to dress. This was the first pair of Clark's in a size 10M I couldn't wear. They were so narrow, I couldn't even get the ball of my foot in the shoe. Really liked the design of the shoe, but the sizing was much different than all my other Clark's.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Watson

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfort at a great price
customer_reviews.text: My husband wore these to a wedding, straight out of the box, no breaking in time and loved them. He said they were very comfortable the entire time. He was amazed how good they felt and said they had great support. He thanked me several times throughout the evening for purchasing the perfect shoe at such a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Toni P.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is one of the most comfortable "dress type" shoes that I have ever purchased. I was very pleasantly surprised by the style, quality, and fit. I am thinking about buying a pair in brown. The insoles are cushioned so they would be very comfortable for someone who expects a long day on their feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are good shoes and I wear them several times a week
customer_reviews.text: These are good shoes and I wear them several times a week. The only thing I don't like about these is that for some reason the seems on the inside rub on the top of my foot sometimes, not all the time though so its weird. It can get annoying if you notice it and you're on your feet all day long. Otherwise a good pair of shoes. Also, I do quite a bit of walking while at work so that might be the reason why or a certain kind of sock my be the reason also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and fit of these shoes. Husband bought them for work shoes. He had surgery on his foot a while ago, so looks for ones that have a lot of cushioning and padding on the bottom. These seem to do the trick for his sensitive area on his foot. Looks top notch. He even keeps them on and walks a mile over lunch when them on. No blisters. Wears well. Looks sharp. Glad we got them.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoe, long lasting, have ordered it several times.
customer_reviews.text: Favorite shoe, long lasting, have ordered it several times. I have a job where I’m on my feet all day. This is incredible all day comfort. It lasts a long time, I wear the same pair every day for an entire year and then re-order the same shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't found a great slip-on shoe for work yet but this one is my go to shoe so far. I've purchased this show two times before this purchase. They last about 1 1/2 years with daily wear before they start looking worn. I usually wear a size 9 shoe but I ended up getting an 8.5 ... so they run a half size big for me. I have a pair in brown and black. I would recommend this shoe given the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shep.

customer_reviews.title: Professional look, with a tennis shoe feel!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know about all the other negative reviews but these are my favorite work shoes! I love professional look but the feel of a tennis shoe. I could wear these all day!!
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Lewis II

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Clarks brand leather slip-on shoe. I wear this and other Clarks shoes in 9.5 M which fit me well. This is a stylish shoe for the office and the sole wears fairly. The tread is not like the long wearing rubber of the past, but a softer compound. When this shoe goes on sale, be sure to have your size ready. It dropped to below 40 at least twice in the last two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: RLewTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Seem like equal if not higher quality (sorry Mr
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to replace my completely worn-out Rockports (3 year old bike toe loafers from Dillards). Seem like equal if not higher quality (sorry Mr. Pirsig), albeit with a harder/slipperier sole - that hopefully wears longer in trade for reduced traction. Even appear to be made to accept replacement soles. I try to avoid buying shoes online but stores rarely carry smaller than size 8 in mens...these are perfectly true to size, with a very comfortable insole. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT C SCHULTZ

customer_reviews.title: Feels Good
customer_reviews.text: Had about two weeks now and the shoe feels pretty good compared to all the other ones in my closet. After a month if my feet still don't hurt I will buy the brown ones.. Most of my shoes my feet will start hurting during mid day of work. These shoes I was able to last all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Need for Arch Supports After Break-in
customer_reviews.text: ...break-in was uncomfortable, and lasted about a month (as I do NOT wear these shoes everyday). But, now that the shoes are broken-in, the leather is softer, and they fit/feel great. I, now, regularly wear these all day without any pain. Also, normally I wear arch supports. But after the break-in, I generally go without them...and still feel great.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTIAN M GARRETT

customer_reviews.title: Look nice and feel even better
customer_reviews.text: I replaced another pair of Clark’s that were really comfortable. The first day, the tongue of the shoe was a little tight across the top of my foot. However after the third day, the leather stretched and they are very comfortable to me. They feel really light on your foot and I do not get hot spots like I do on my Allen Edmonds.
customer_reviews.author: Tri Guy

customer_reviews.title: Lacks support and durability
customer_reviews.text: Looks fine, fits fine, doesn't last. I work in a high school and would wear these almost every day. They aren't that comfortable so I put in some inserts to make them have better support. After approximately 6 months of use the sole split. They were never used for anything other than basic office work and they basically broke in half.
customer_reviews.author: John Barthuly

customer_reviews.title: Skip these
customer_reviews.text: I am a longtime Clark’s fan. I have had several different styles in the past and wanted these to be my new favorites. They fell very short on that. The shoe feels cheap. It felt like an imitation with Clark’s name on the insole. On the foot, very little comfort. In the hand, cheap and plastic like. I immediately returned them and will continue to buy Clark’s from the local outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon NY

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not the same.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Clarks shoes for around 15 years. In the past year or so they have discontinued the shoes that I usually buy and replaced them with a cheap version that doesn't fit, and the leather upper and rubber sole is not even close to the same quality. Since then I have ordered several different styles thinking I would find one that I like but end up disappointed every time. In my opinion, you have ruined your brand and have lost me as a customer. I have also read other similar reviews so I'm not the only one.
customer_reviews.author: joe h

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my hubby and he loves them. He has a similar style Clark's in brown and wanted a black pair. This was the closest one I could find and he has no issues with them. They look better in person than online. Happy and recommend!
customer_reviews.author: asmith922

customer_reviews.title: Very Cheaply Made - poor quality overall - not durable whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheaply made shoes - purchased in November of 2019 as of a week ago (today is January 27th,) the soles of the shoes began to crack and the right shoe is split. Not even 6 months ... not even 3 months. Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Love em, but lighter than picture shows
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are stylish and comfortable. The color is a few shades lighter than what is pictured (which worked out better for me) and more tan in tone. I purchased these in black a year ago, and those ones are still holding up and I wear them 3-4 days a week. Not often to find shoes that are durable these days. I also love that they come in the wider width.
customer_reviews.author: Craigery

customer_reviews.title: First time to buy Clarks shoe. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Normally buy Ecco's(they dont seem to last more then 7 months though), but these were on sale. Have to say I love them. Great fit and comfort equal to Ecco's I had. Will have to see how they last over time. Also, like the look better.
customer_reviews.author: eric raven

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, easily water stained, pretty bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: The outer part after the stitching is poorly cut, it gets stained so easily. I read this brand is one of the most comfortable shoes to work. Well starting with their poor appearance quality bad to take them to work and most importantly the confort is extremely overated, their only slightly more soft than regular shoes. Which obviously after a few hours their rough on your feet. In terms of grip also not that good
customer_reviews.author: Tiago L

customer_reviews.title: Really great shoes for the price
customer_reviews.text: They last a long time, and they're comfortable. The con would be as others mentioned, perhaps a bit slippery when you first start wearing them, because of the bottom of the shoes. No problem after a week of using regarding that. Love everything else about the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Best work shoe for me thus far
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many brands, Timberlands usually, dockers, and a half dozen others. These Clarks are by far the most comfortable. good quality, no insoles needed. built in support. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Salvaggio

customer_reviews.title: The shoe lasts a long time.. but you probably want to replace the insole..
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the insole on my previous version of this.. and when this first week in the original insoles has been building up calluses. Will be either using my better socks.. or pulling out the insoles and using the upgrades from the previous pair. (This seems like a nearly perfect shoe with a replaced insole.. :). Lasts me over a year..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Dooley

customer_reviews.title: These are my husbands absolute FAVORITE casual/dress shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are my husbands absolute FAVORITE casual/dress shoes! He spends most of his work day on his feet, an average of 10 - 12 hours per day, and he raves about how comfortable they are! For how he wears them (frequency and duration) the tread and inside support lasts a very long time. He was incredibly disappointed when we could no longer find these in the stores, and we tried a few other Clark styles but none were as comfortable nor lasted as long. He was thrilled when I found these on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: mlbdld

customer_reviews.title: 1st amazon review
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to getting these shoes despite the mixed reviews. I thought whatever, I’ll give em a shot. I opened the box and immediately realized that the sole of the shoe is like some weird PLASTIC material. The top part of the shoe is great. The leather was nice and shiny, the inside of the shoe had nice material in it but the plastic sole turned me off. I didn’t have the shoes in my house for longer than 10 mins before I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: sam r.

customer_reviews.title: and I believe they've stretched to a comfortable level. May invest in another pair (just because ...
customer_reviews.text: I get 9.5E for the most part, but this particular Clark style shoe didn't have wide width's so I did what I usually do (up a size to 10). The 10 was still a little tight in width, but I have been wearing for a little bit now, and I believe they've stretched to a comfortable level. May invest in another pair (just because I go through shoe soles quickly for some reason)l I'm hoping the soles with this pair hold out like a previous pair of Clarks I had (which lasted probably 10 years before the uppers began to fray AND the soles began to get thin).
customer_reviews.author: Rokko-FFXVA

customer_reviews.title: Second time around
customer_reviews.text: My husband got a black pair of these same shoes for Christmas. He loved them so much that he begged me for a pair of brown ones, too! I got those for him, and he is pleased as punch.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Hobgood Strauss

customer_reviews.title: They look like like cheap shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are comfortable but I was expecting a better quality. They are poorly finished, the edge looks sloppy glued and it makes me believe they will break from there, I’ve used them two days only, we’ll see. I don’t recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Not dressy.....Not casual
customer_reviews.text: These are tough to wear as they are not really good for jeans or for dress pants. They are better casual. They definitely don't work with a suit or dress pant.
customer_reviews.author: tk_atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Want to love but...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes do not fit the same. The right shoe is significantly looser than the left, causing irritation when walking. Would love to exchange or verify they are actually the same shoe. Love the look. Disappointed in fit.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sumsion

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have believed the recent reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to believe the recent negative reviews. I've owned these shoes before and they were great. I can tell from my first day of wearing these that they are not what they once were. There are stitches that are already fraying and my feet are killing me. They fit perfect, but if I have to put a thick insert in them, they wont fit properly. I'm just disappointed I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian H.

customer_reviews.title: If the shoe fits
customer_reviews.text: Then wear it. These shoes fit just fine as ordered. They were a little tight initially but it is leather and it is designed to stretch. If you buy the shoe and it is a little loose it will expand more and be a little too big.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Deckert

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These Clark's were on par with most of their lineup. They are full leather shoes so breathability is a concern however they are comfortable and allow for all day wear.
customer_reviews.author: HufflePuffle

customer_reviews.title: True to size
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this purchase! My husband is very picky about his shoes. Buying shoes without trying them on is risky but they were perfect. We purchased his normal size and they were true to size.
customer_reviews.author: angela beall

customer_reviews.title: REPEAT BUYER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my husband’s third pair of these! He LOVES them. He walks a lot for his job. He’s suffered with plantar fasciitis for years. These are the only tried and true shoes that don’t kill his feet. Every time I order a replacement pair I pray they haven’t been discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Oystergirl

customer_reviews.title: I Like These Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and easy to wear. Clarks are my favorite inexpensive dress shoes and these do not disappoint. I purchased a wide size but they seem to run just slightly narrow. Not enough to be a problem, but just noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: The Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Were have these been all my life?!
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best shoes that I have ever purchased! They look great, aren't too dressy looking, and sooo comfortable!! These are the only shoes that I can wear all day at work, go out walking around the city until last call, walk home, and have no pain whatsoever! I can barely stand any of my other shoes now. I think I need to stockpile these...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Phillips

customer_reviews.title: size 10 fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Good looking light weight comfortable shoes. Size 10 fit me as expected. No breaking in required, wore entire day at work first day I wore them. Wearing them about a week so far. I love the soft leather insides. Well cushioned heel.
customer_reviews.author: Ed W.

customer_reviews.title: M width was tigher than expected, W width was  perfect
customer_reviews.text: Originally ordered the M width in these but they were too tight. Reordered as a W and they were perfect. Very comfortable shoes for wearing all day at work and look great with jeans of slacks. I do not normally order W width but found the M too narrow for me.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have two other pair of Clark’s that feel great. These feel cheap! Thin plastic like leather and very slippery on the soles. They didn’t look bad in the picture, but in person they are not attractive at all. These feel like knockoffs.
customer_reviews.author: David Bird

customer_reviews.title: Not Wide at all .... ☹☹
customer_reviews.text: Im madd , they say WIDE . didnt fit me at all .... I will return 2 pair of good Quality Shoes that doesnt fit me .... ☹☹ They are not Wide , no matter that is label that way..
customer_reviews.author: Carlos E Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes for my husband. They are the only shoes that give him comfort. He can wear them all day with comfort. They are nice for dressing up but can also be worn casually.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a wear to work shoe but they're so comfortable and solid that I wear then all the time, they look nice, feel great, very supportive, I can't say enough about how comfortable they are, Clark's makes a high quality shoe, this is the 3rd pair I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: darin fischer

product_meta.title: Clarks Men's Escalade Step
product_meta.description:
Comfortable mens casual

Clarks has been in business for over 100 years making very fine men's dress shoes in a variety of styles. Featuring a wide range of top-quality components, Clarks gives you the options you desire in the quality you demand.
